Article Title: Former Punjab minister Harmel Tohra passes away at 72
Article Text:
Former Punjab minister Harmel Tohra passes away at 72

PATIALA: Former Punjab minister Harmail Singh Tohra passed away after a prolonged illness at a private hospital in Mohali on Sunday evening. He was 77.Tohra was the son-in-law of Akali stalwart late Gurcharan Singh Tohra.His last rites will be performed at his native village Tohra on September 23.Tohra won from the Dakala Assembly constituency in 1997 and became the PWD minister in the Akali government.In 2016, he joined the Aam Aadmi Party but he returned to the Shiromani Akali Dal in 2019.
Article Summary: Harmail Singh Tohra passed away after a prolonged illness at a private hospital in Mohali on Sunday evening. He was 77. His last rites will be performed at his native village TohRA on September 23. He won from Dakala Assembly constituency in 1997 and became the PWD minister in the Akali government.

Article Title: 'Not an MLA, but get Rs 20 cr in funds': Sena leader Sarvankar boasts; later clarifies
Article Text:
Shiv Sena MLA Sada Sarvankar

NEW DELHI: Former Shiv Sena MLA Sada Sarvankar stirred controversy after a viral video showed him claiming he secures more funds for his constituency than the sitting legislator.Sarvankar, according to news agency PTI, told a gathering, "the incumbent MLA gets Rs 2 crore, but even when I am not an MLA and I get Rs 20 crore."When contacted, he clarified that he was referring to the funds he manages to bring into the Dadar-Mahim constituency, contrasting it with Sawant’s complaints of inadequate resources.A key figure in the 2022 rebellion, Sarvankar was among the 39 MLAs who sided with Eknath Shinde against then chief minister Uddhav Thackeray Sarvankar, who heads the Siddhivinayak Trust, had lost the 2024 Maharashtra assembly election to Shiv Sena (UBT) candidate Mahesh Sawant.
Article Summary: Former Shiv Sena MLA Sada Sarvankar stirred controversy after a viral video showed him claiming he secures more funds for his constituency than the sitting legislator. A key figure in the 2022 rebellion, he was among the 39 MLAs who sided with Eknath Shinde against then chief minister Uddhav Thackeray.

Article Title: Watch: CJI BR Gavai enjoys camel ride in Bikaner; joined by law minister Arjun Ram Meghwal
Article Text:
.

Poll Should public figures engage in leisure activities in a public setting? Yes, it's good for their image No, it undermines their authority

Chief justice of India BR Gavai was seen enjoying a camel cart ride with union law minister Arjun Ram Meghwal on Saturday in Bikaner.A video, obtained from a third-party source and shared by PTI, shows the two sitting and chatting on the camel cart during night time. Police can also be seen deployed in the area for security.
Article Summary: Chief justice of India BR Gavai was seen enjoying a camel cart ride with union law minister Arjun Ram Meghwal. A video, obtained from a third-party source and shared by PTI, shows the two sitting and chatting on the camel cart during night time.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: Two more parties join Mahagathbandhan; seat-sharing deal to get complex?
Article Text:
PM Modi’s 'Kosi' Jibe at Opposition Ignites Bihar Election Heat During MP Flats Inauguration

NEW DELHI: The seat-sharing negotiations for upcoming assembly elections in Bihar have become more complex as two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The situation is getting trickier as major parties are firm on their seat demands.The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.“Two more parties are expected to be part of the INDIA bloc soon and we all have to sacrifice our share of seats to accommodate the new partners.” State Congress president Rajesh Kumar told reporters after a discussion during a key meeting of INDIA bloc leaders at the official residence of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.Meanwhile, Congress insist that it cannot go below the 70 seats.VIP chief Mukesh Sahani, on the other hand, has demanded “60 seats plus the post of deputy CM” while the CPI-ML is pressing for at least 40 seats, pointing to its past performance.The RJD is also unwilling to contest on fewer than 150 seats.In 2020 assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal had contested on 144 seats, of which it won 75.Congress won 19 out of 70 seats.CPI-ML contested 19 seats and won 12.CPM contested 4 seats and was successful in winning 2 seats.CPI contested on 6 seats and won 2 seats.RJD's Tejashwi Yadav has already declared himself as the CM face of the opposition INDIA bloc.Addressing the rally in Ara town, the last stopover of the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra', Tejashwi questioned the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar for "frequently copying his ideas" and described it as a "copycat government". Ridiculing the government for copying his ideas, he said that at present he was moving ahead while the govt was behind him."Tejashwi aage-aage, Sarkar pichhe-pichhe. Original CM chahiye ki duplicate?" (Tejashwi is moving ahead while the govt is following him from behind. Do you want a duplicate CM or the original CM?), Tejashwi asked the crowd.
Article Summary: Two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.

Article Title: Himachal Pradesh minister Vikramaditya Singh to marry Panjab University professor Amreen Kaur in Chandigarh today
Article Text:
Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri wishes messages and colours

SHIMLA: Himachal Pradesh public works department(PWD) and urban development minister Vikramaditya Singh(35) is going to tie the knot with a Punjabi girl Amreen Kaur in Chandigarh today. This would be his second marriage.Vikramaditya belongs to the royal family of princely state of Bushahr in Shimla district and is son of six time late chief minister Virbhadra Singh and Himachal Congress president Pratibha Singh.Amreen, who has done PhD in psychology, is assistant professor in Panjab University, Chandigarh. She is daughter of Punjab and Haryana high court advocate Jotinder Singh Sekhon and Opinder Kaur.The Sekhon family originally hails from Kalbanjara village in Sangrur district but is now settled in Sector 2, Chandigarh.Vikramaditya had earlier married Sudarshana Singh Chundawat of Amet royal family of Rajsamand in Mewar, Rajasthan on March 8, 2019.Later, in 2022, owing to differences, Chundawat had filed a domestic violence and harassment case in the Udaipur court against Vikramaditya’s family and had also alleged that Vikramaditya was having an affair with a Chandigarh girl Amreen Kaur. But the couple later parted ways through a mutual divorce last year.
Article Summary: Vikramaditya belongs to the royal family of princely state of Bushahr in Shimla district. He is son of six time late chief minister Virbhadra Singh and Himachal Congress president Pratibha Singh. Amreen, who has done PhD in psychology, is assistant professor in Panjab University.
